results.title: Jan. 6 Panel Secures Deal for Cipollone to Be Interviewed
results.abstract: The former White House counsel pushed back on President Donald J. Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election and was in the West Wing to witness his actions on Jan. 6, 2021.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

results.title: Explosion Destroys Mysterious Monument in Georgia, Authorities Say
results.abstract: For more than four decades, the Georgia Guidestones near Elberton Ga., have been an enigma. On Wednesday, the authorities said, “unknown individuals” destroyed a large part of the structure.

media.caption: The Georgia Guidestones monument near Elberton, Ga., was torn apart by an explosive device on Wednesday, the authorities said.

results.title: An N.F.L. Star’s C.T.E. Diagnosis Offers Only Partial Insight
results.abstract: Demaryius Thomas had C.T.E. when he died in December at 33, but the posthumous diagnosis alone does not explain what role football had in the charismatic N.F.L. star’s quick decline.

media.caption: When Thomas left the field after Super Bowl 50, he had a headache so bad that he missed most of the celebrations after.

results.title: ‘The Golden Age of Thrifting Is Over’
results.abstract: A glut of fast fashion has made its way into local thrift stores, making it hard for women who have been purchasing secondhand for decades to find quality garments they can wear.

media.caption: In addition to driving up thrift stores’ operating costs, thoughtless donating can make it more difficult for people in search of durable wardrobe staples to find what they’re looking for.

results.title: The suspect and his family had long ties to Highland Park and a troubled past.

results.title: Her ‘Chagall’ Is Headed for the Trash. How’s That for Caveat Emptor?
results.abstract: Stephanie Clegg paid $90,000 for a Marc Chagall painting at a Sotheby’s auction in 1994. It was reappraised for $100,000 in 2008. Now an expert panel in France wants to destroy it as a fake.

media.caption: Stephanie Clegg, an art collector, said she is upset that a Marc Chagall painting she bought at Sotheby’s in 1994 has been declared a fake and is threatened with being destroyed.
media.copyright: Aaron Richter for The New York Times

results.title: Funeral Home Operator Pleads Guilty in ‘Illegal Body Part Scheme’
results.abstract: Megan Hess, who pleaded guilty to mail fraud, sold body parts without families’ consent in a business she operated with her mother, officials said.

media.caption: Megan Hess, operator of Donor Services, in Montrose, Colo., pleaded guilty to mail fraud on Tuesday.

results.byline: By Matthew Haag and Ben Protess
results.title: Real Estate Firm Tied to Trump Inquiry Fined for Contempt of Court
results.abstract: The firm, Cushman & Wakefield, was ordered to pay $10,000 a day until it complies with a subpoena. It appraised several Trump properties that are at the center of the New York attorney general’s investigation.

media.caption: The New York attorney general, Letitia James, plans to call former President Donald J. Trump and his children for questioning next week in a civil investigation into the family’s company.

results.title: Cancer Drug Greatly Reduces Deaths in Hospitalized Covid Patients
results.abstract: A new study found that sabizabulin reduced the risk of death by 55 percent, but some experts were cautious about overinterpreting the results.

media.caption: The late-stage clinical trial for sabizabulin called for volunteers who were already in the hospital for Covid.

results.title: Amazon Prime Grubhub Deal: What to Know
results.abstract: A deal between Amazon and the food distribution service Grubhub includes free delivery for Prime members.

media.caption: Grubhub+ was offered to Amazon Prime members on Wednesday as an additional perk. Amazon has dabbled in the delivery business before.
